summary: Policy advisor, consultant and researcher in the field of environmental economics and policy with about fifteen years experience. Enthusiastic, professional, hard-working. Can work both independently and in (international) teams. Area of expertise include policy and project evaluation, Cost-Benefit Analysis (CBA) and valuation of environmental goods and services.

profile_positions.description:
As a Policy Advisor at Milieu, I have contributed to several projects including:
- Study on shifting priorities towards post-COVID sustainable reconstruction and recovery (2021)
- Study on mainstreaming environment in EU transport funding (2020)
- Study on financing biodiversity action: challenges and opportunities for subnational authorities
- Study on integration of environmental concerns in the Cohesion Policy (2017).
- Support to the Commission in the evaluation of the contribution of OPs and RDPs to the implementation of the EU water policy (2017)
- Evaluation Study to Support the Fitness Check of the Birds and Habitats Directive. Responsible for the evaluation questions regarding coherence of the Nature Directives with other EU policies (2015).
- Ex-post Evaluation of Cohesion Policy Programmes 2007-2013 co-financed by the ERDF/CF. Work Package 6: Environment’ (2015). 
- Analysis of the manuals of procedures for the permit granting process applicable to projects of common interest. Responsible for the case study of Poland (2015).
profile_positions.title: Policy Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Involved in several consulting projects in the field of environmental economics and policy analysis, including:
- A project for Council of Europe Development Bank (2012-2013). Carried out evaluation of 11 energy efficiency projects implemented in various locations in Poland with support of the CEB credits (municipal projects, hospitals, building cooperatives). Carried out field work, prepared detailed reports and a background policy paper including analysis of functioning of the thermo-modernisation fund in Poland.
- A project with Milieu Ltd.: “Support to develop guidance for streamlining environmental assessment procedures of energy infrastructure projects of common interest” (2012). Reviewed the procedures of EIA in Poland, carried out interviews with the representatives of the Polish administration and the companies.
- A project with CE Delft (2012) “A Study on Integrated Urban Transport Plans and Cohesion Policy”, for the European Parliament. The project included several case studies from various cities in Europe. Responsible for analysing urban transport plan of Kraków and for distributing and analysing questionnaires related to the relevant Operational Programmes and specific projects implemented in Kraków within these programmes.
- A project with CE Delft “The full costs of road and rail transport” for the Community of European Railways (CER). The project analysed full costs of road and railway infrastructure in 4 countries: the Netherlands, Germany, Great Britain and Poland. Responsible for obtaining and partly analysing the data for Poland, writing parts of the report and the Annex about Poland (2011-2012).
profile_positions.title: Onderzoeker

profile_positions.description:
Involved in several consulting projects in the field of environmental economics and policy analysis, including: 
-	Behavioural climate change mitigation options and their appropriate inclusion in quantitative longer term policy scenarios (2011); for the European Commission.
-	Why the EU could and should adopt higher greenhouse gas reduction targets - A literature review (2010); for the European Parliament.
-	Shadow Prices Handbook - Valuation and weighting of emissions and environmental impacts (2008-2010); for the Dutch Ministry of Environment.
-	Technical support for European action to reducing Greenhouse Gas Emissions from international maritime transport (2008-2009); for the European Commission, DG ENV.
-	External Costs of Coal, a report with estimates of external costs of coal combustion around the World; for Greenpeace International.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Involved in several research projects in the field of environmental economics and policy analysis, including:
-	POLFOREX – A project focusing on valuation of non-market benefits provided by forests, implemented by the WEEC in cooperation with the Polish Institute of Forestry. Wrote parts of the report from the project related to Cost-Benefit Analysis (2010).
-	CASES - Cost Assessment for Sustainable Energy Systems, Sixth EU Framework Programme. Collecting data related to private and social costs of energy production in Poland and Hungary (2008).
-	Odra - a project funded by WWF Germany focused on inland waterway transport along the Odra River. Coordinator of the team from the Warsaw University. The principal element of the project was Cost-Benefit Analysis of the investments aimed at facilitating transport along the Odra river (2008).
-	MethodEx - Methods and data on environmental and health externalities, Sixth EU Framework Programme. Working on a summary of the existing Polish studies on environmental externalities and on a new case study on valuating eutrophication effects in Poland (concerning lake Legowskie). Presentation of the outcomes of the case study during the meeting in Budapest in December 2005. The project finished in December 2006.
-	NEEDS – New Energy Externalities Developments for Sustainability, Sixth EU Framework Programme. Involved mainly in adaptation of the CVM questionnaires aimed at eliciting Value of Life Year (VOLY) to the Polish conditions. The project finished in March 2006.
-	EUROCAT – European Catchments. Catchments Changes and their Impact on the Coast. Fifth EU Framework Programme. Contributing to the part related to costs and benefits of cleaning up the Baltic Sea, Warsaw University, Economics Department, 2003.
profile_positions.title: Researcher
